input_text:
Job Title: Logistics Coordinator II

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Diasorin is a global leader in diagnostic solutions, pushing the boundaries of science and technology to create cutting-edge tools that improve healthcare worldwide. With a legacy spanning over 50 years, we've earned our reputation for excellence by developing innovative diagnostic assays and instruments that are trusted by healthcare providers around the world.

Our broad offering of diagnostic tests and Licensed Technology solutions, made available thanks to ongoing investments in research, positions us as the player with the widest range of specialty solutions in the sector and identifies us as the "Diagnostics Specialist."

Why Join Diasorin?

Impactful Work: When you join Diasorin, you become part of a team that's dedicated to improving lives. Your contributions will directly impact patient care, making a meaningful difference in the world. Global Reach & Innovation: Our work transcends borders. Joining Diasorin means collaborating with colleagues from all over the world, expanding your horizons, and contributing to global healthcare solutions at the forefront of the diagnostic industry. 

Diverse and Inclusive Culture: We believe in the strength of diversity, and our inclusive culture reflects this commitment. We value your unique perspective and offer a supportive, collaborative environment where everyone can thrive.

Join Our Team: If you're passionate about innovation, diversity, and making a positive impact on healthcare, Diasorin is the place for you. We're looking for passionate and talented individuals who are ready to embrace new challenges and drive healthcare solutions forward.

Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of diagnostics? Join Diasorin and become a catalyst for change in the world of healthcare. Apply today and be a part of our exciting journey toward a healthier, more connected world. Together, we can make an impact!

Job Scope

The Logistics Coordinator II performs activities related to the receipt, put-away, storage, picking, movement, and shipping of material within the Supply Chain. This role must have high regard for attention to detail, decision making, leadership, and be able to oversee the adherence to OSHA, DOT, IATA, FDA, and other regulations.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

Ensure that all applicable duties are conducted and performed according to approved procedures IAW ISO 9001 which may include but not limited to RMA processing, receipts, order distribution, MMDs, shipping transactions, MRB coordination, material packaging, and NCMRs.Process receiving/stockroom/shipping transactions quickly, accurately, and completely in the Oracle ERP system.Create / maintain detailed reporting on all applicable functions as required.Interacts with various internal and external groups to facilitate the completion of the all activities.Maintain product integrity throughout the movement cycle of materials by handling sensitive products appropriately.Prepare appropriate receiving, stockroom, and shipping documentation in compliance with all domestic and international regulations (IATA, hazmat, customs, etc.).Quality focused. Check orders for quantity accuracy, record and check serial numbers and lot numbers, obtain secondary verifications as required. Perform incoming and outgoing inspections as needed.Serves as an inventory accuracy lead; ensures that cycle counts are completed timely and precisely. Researches and mitigates inventory issues as needed.Proactively order and restock supplies for use during day to day functions (boxes, foam, dry ice, cold packs, bags, labels- etc.) to ensure continuous operational readiness.Ability to drive company vehicles and operate Luminex equipment such as forklifts, pallet jacks, carts, and motorized pallet stackers to receive/store/distribute/ship material.Keeps accurate records and maintain appropriate filing system.A workplace professional who demonstrates excellent safety practices and behavioral poise.Maintains a clean and orderly work environment. Keep areas 5S compliant.Works with 3PL providers to ensure material is stored, issued, and shipped timely and accurately.Ability to investigate various receiving, stockroom, and/or shipping related issues and provide status updates to customers and stakeholders.May develop cross-training plans and serve as a departmental training coordinator ensuring that all training is completed per SOP.Process improvement advocate that drives efficiency by updating and drafting SOPs / work instructions as needed.

Education, Experience, And Qualifications

H.S. Diploma requiredAssociate's Degree Business, Supply Chain, Engineering, Science, or equivalent preferred2+ Years Experience in domestic and international receiving, warehouse, logistics or shipping required2+ Years Experience in receiving, packaging, handling, and shipping of sensitive material, especially cold chain products preferred2+ Years Experience using forklifts and/or other material handling equipment preferred2+ Years Experience in a Medical Device, Pharma, or other Healthcare field preferred2+ Years Experience using an ERP system in a manufacturing environment preferred2+ Years Experience with oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) preferred2+ Years Experience in a GMP and/or FDA regulated environment preferred2+ Years Experience in using Microsoft Office, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skills (High proficiency)Ability to handle the pressure of meeting tight deadlines (High proficiency)Ability to work independently with minimal supervision (High proficiency)Ability to follow written and verbal instructions. (High proficiency)Highly organized with proven time management and prioritization skills (High proficiency)Ability to work in a fast-paced environment (High proficiency)Ability to make a customer impact decision when challenged with multiple priorities. (High proficiency)Ability to recognize a product integrity handling issue and take action to stabilize material. (High proficiency)Ability to recognize potential issues and escalate to management. (compliance, DG, safety, hazardous material handling, etc.) (High proficiency)Advanced knowledge of rules and regulations to include DOT, OSHA, IATA, and FDA. (High proficiency)

Licenses, Certifications, Physical Demands and Working Conditions

Driver's License (Site specific, notice will be given if not required): RequiredLogistics/Trade Compliance or Hazardous Handling/Shipping certifications: PreferredForklift certification, or ability to obtain certification (Site specific, notice will be given if not required): PreferredStanding – OccasionallyStooping – OccasionallyBending – OccasionallyClimbing – OccasionallySitting – OccasionallyKneeling - OccasionallyMust work onsite at Luminex office – FrequentlyPossible exposure to biological or chemical hazards, Lasers, Excessive Noise, etc. - FrequentlyWork is normally performed in a typical manufacturing environment – FrequentlyFrequent use of personal computers, copiers, printers, and telephones - FrequentlyPotentially moving around machinery. May be exposed to marked changes in temperature and/or humidity, dust, fumes, gases, and radiation – FrequentlySpecific vision abilities required by this job include vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and ability to adjust focus - FrequentlyThe noise level in the work environment is usually moderate – Frequently10% Travel may be required

What We Offer

Receive a competitive salary and benefits package as you grow your career at Diasorin. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world.

Diasorin is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and Canada and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Diasorin is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are a US or Canada candidate and require assistance or accommodation during the application process, please contact the North America Talent Acquisition Team at hrtalent@diasorin.com or 1-800-328-1482 to request an accommodation.

The above job description is intended to describe the general content, identify the essential functions, and set forth the requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements.

Diasorin reserves the right to modify or amend this job posting as needed to comply with local laws and regulations.

Please note that offers of employment at Diasorin may be contingent upon successful completion of a pre-employment background check and drug screen, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

This position is not eligible for partnership with a third-party search firm vendor without expressed, written consent from the Diasorin Human Resources Department.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
